page.title: 03HOUSING IN OLDBURY
page.content: Most of the houses in Oldbury range from about 100-600 years old. They are mostly made of stone and are farms or cottages, though there is a small council estate. From the population of about 700 we worked out that there is about 150 properties. Not many houses are sold or built but when they are sold they are very expensive ranging from Â£50,000-Â£250,000. Because of this not many people with young families move into the village. This could eventually affect the school numbers. The gardens are mostly large. They have to be neat and tidy as the village enters the Best Kept Village competition. Many people keep animals on small holdings.
